titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8015) to maintain prompt and reliable postal services during the COVID-19 health emergency, and for other purposes.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8015) to maintain prompt and reliable postal services during the COVID-19 health emergency, and for other purposes.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1092.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 116-480, by Mr. McGovern.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8015 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 90.

action.text: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 171 (Roll no. 179).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 171 (Roll no. 180).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 8015 (Delivering for America Act ) to maintain prompt and reliable postal services during the COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) public health emergency.
